goals.question: What is the distribution of package sizes in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of package sizes in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns in the distribution.

goals.question: What is the relationship between package size and number of dependencies in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of package size vs. number of dependencies
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between package size and number of dependencies. It can also help us identify any outliers or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What are the most common dependencies in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most commonly used dependencies in the dataset and understand their relative frequency.

goals.question: What is the distribution of package types in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of different types of packages in the dataset and identify any patterns or outliers.

goals.question: What is the average number of dependencies per package in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.visualization: Box plot of number of dependencies
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of number of dependencies per package and identify any outliers or patterns. The box plot will also give us information about the median and quartiles of the data.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='size', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['size'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['size'].median()))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of package sizes in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['size'] = data['size'].astype(float)
    data['depends'] = data['depends'].astype(float)
    chart = sns.scatterplot(x='size', y='depends', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between package size and number of dependencies in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    return chart

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('name').size().reset_index(name='count').sort_values('count', ascending=False)
    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
    sns.barplot(x='count', y='name', data=data, palette='Blues_d')
    plt.title('What are the most common dependencies in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Dependency Frequency')
    plt.ylabel('Dependency Name')
    plt.tight_layout()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    package_types = data.groupby('type').size().reset_index(name='counts')
    plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
    plt.pie(package_types['counts'], labels=package_types['type'], autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of package types in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['value'] = data['value'].astype(int)
    sns.boxplot(x='value', data=data)
    plt.axvline(data['value'].mean(), color='r', linestyle='--', label='Mean')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the average number of dependencies per package in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
